Class FilterEventsDialogFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
com.example.ajilore.code.ui.events.FilterEventsDialogFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class FilterEventsDialogFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.DialogFragment
DialogFragment that provides filtering controls for the Events list.

This component supports US 01.01.04 â€” allowing entrants to filter events based on date range, event type (category), and availability (open/closed). It is displayed as a fullscreen modal dialog, giving users an intuitive UI for selecting multiple criteria.

Supported Filter Types

  • Date Range: Select a continuous range via calendar chips.
  • Categories: Party, Workshop, Other (multi-select).
  • Availability: Open or Closed (single-select).

Persistent Filter State

The dialog stores the most recently applied filters in a static FilterEventsDialogFragment.EventFilters object, and restores them when reopened.

Usage

 FilterEventsDialogFragment dialog = FilterEventsDialogFragment.newInstance();
 dialog.setFiltersListener(filters -> { ... });
 dialog.show(getSupportFragmentManager(), "filters");

When the user applies or clears filters, the dialog passes results to the host through FilterEventsDialogFragment.OnFiltersAppliedListener.

    • getCurrentFilters

      public static FilterEventsDialogFragment.EventFilters getCurrentFilters()
      Returns the most recently applied filter selections.

      This allows the Events screen to show active filter badges or reapply the filter to the Firestore query.

      Returns:
      The saved FilterEventsDialogFragment.EventFilters instance.
